name: Can Your Monkey Do The Dog - Christopher Wool and Josh Smith
description:
Title:  Can Your Monkey Do The Dog
Artists:  Josh Smith and Christopher Wool

can your monkey do the dog was conceived jointly by Josh Smith and Christopher Wool. Working together they produced collaborative images based upon images from both artist's catalogue of work. The idea of reproduction is addressed through the manipulation of pixelated brushstrokes, xerox and light reflection.

    Softcover
    168 pages
    10 1/2" long x 8 1/4" wide
    Limited edition of 1000 copies and 300 artist’s proofs
    Published in 2007 by Michèle Didier

name: James Turrell - Signed Exhibition Catalogue
description:
Signed by James Turrell.

Contributions by Carmen Giménez, Nat Trotman, and Arthur Zajonc

This full-color catalogue accompanies the exhibition at the Guggenheim, detailing the production of the rotunda installation and situating it in the context of James Turrell’s career. 

In addition to beautifully reproduced images featuring the artist’s early works, his magnum opus Roden Crater Project (1979– ), and documentation of Aten Reign (2013), this volume includes essays by the show’s curators, Stephen and Nan Swid Curator of Twentieth-Century Art Carmen Giménez and Associate Curator Nat Trotman, and Arthur Zajonc, emeritus professor of physics at Amherst College. 

James Turrell investigates the significance of the new work for the Guggenheim in terms of Turrell’s ongoing relationships with architecture, the landscape, and perceptual experience.

    Hardcover
    11 3/4" tall x 9 3/4" wide
    128 pages, fully illustrated
    Published in 2013

name: James Turrell - Guggenheim Ltd. Ed. Exhibition Poster (Signed)
description:

    36" tall x 24" wide

name: Christopher Wool - Limited Edition Guggenheim Retrospective Ltd. Ed. Poster
description:

name: Tom Sachs - Nutsy Bic Limited Edition Lighter
description:
Limited Edition "White" Lighter:

Jim Morrison, Jimi Hendrix, Janis Joplin, and Kurt Cobain were all left-handed, all died at the age of 27, and autopsies reported each having a white bic lighter in their pockets. This is why it is said that white lighters are unlucky.  

Leave it to Tom Sachs and his special brand of twisted humor and social commentary to offer his fans an object with such a macabre association with the past.

name: Tauba Auerbach - "Congratulations" Signed Limited Edition Button
description:
Artist:  Tauba Auerbach
Title:  "Congratulations"

These buttons were originally released in January 2013 as a limited edition set of 150 sold exclusively through Will Brown’s Mission District storefront gallery in her hometown of San Francisco.

Like nearly everything she releases in limited quantities recently, these buttons sold out almost immediately and have become something of a rarety even on the secondary sale market.  

Original Press Release:
"To celebrate the dawn of an exciting new year, multi-talented artist Tauba Auerbach has created a very special limited edition set of CONGRATULATIONS! buttons available exclusively through Will Brown, San Francisco’s favorite experimental exhibition space. All proceeds will go toward continued programming at Will Brown’s Mission District storefront gallery."

Pinback button with five hand-cut grosgrain ribbons attached

4" x 9"

Signed and numbered by the Artist Tauba Auerbach

Edition of 150 (No. 40 out of 150)

name: Sol Lewitt - Retrospective (2013)
description:
BRAND NEW SEALED Sol LeWitt Hardcover (SOLD OUT in ALL MAJOR BOOK STORES)

by Lucy Lippard (Author) , Rosalind Krauss (Author) , Béatrice Gross (Editor) , Sol Lewitt (Artist) 

Magnificent in scope, design and scholarship, this essential volume is the first comprehensive LeWitt monograph published since the artist's death, and the first overview since 2000. 

Besides gathering visual documentation of LeWitt's wall drawings and his sculptures-or "structures" as he preferred-the publication also includes his complete writings; spreads from his artist's books; plus interviews and essays by virtually every artist and author closely associated with LeWitt, among them Lucy Lippard, Rosalind Krauss, Mel Bochner, Dan Graham and Robert Smithson. 

One of the most important artists of the twentieth century, LeWitt at last receives the definitive treatment of his work in this volume.
In his 1967 "Paragraphs on Conceptual Art," Sol LeWitt set out the fundamental principle of his artistic practice: "In conceptual art the idea or concept is the most important aspect of the work.... 

The idea becomes a machine that makes the art." From the first wall drawing in 1968 until his death in 2007, LeWitt never ceased to develop new "machines," conceiving some 1,200 wall drawings and laying down the foundations of Conceptual and Minimalist art. 

LeWitt's wall drawings, always installed by assistants, eliminated any intermediary object (such as a canvas) between the work and its support, thereby dovetailing a sensuous material immediacy with a powerful Platonic detachment. His sculptural variations on grids, cubes and pyramids likewise project this moving simplicity and clarity.

Sol LeWitt (1928-2007) was born in Hartford, Connecticut, where he took art classes at the Wadsworth Atheneum. After receiving a BFA from Syracuse University he worked as a graphic designer in the office of architect I.M. Pei. In 1976, LeWitt cofounded the artists' book bookstore Printed Matter in New York, with Lucy Lippard.

 A retrospective of his wall drawings opened to the public in 2008 at MASS MoCA in North Adams, Massachusetts, where it will remain on view for 25 years.

name: Tauba Auerbach - The Thing Quaterly Limited Edition Clock
Marc Quinn - "Eye Of History" Limited Edition Print (Framed)
description:
Artist:  Marc Quinn
Title:  "Eye of History"

THIS ARCHIVAL INKJET PRINT IS A LIMITED EDITION AND COMES SIGNED AND NUMBERED BY THE ARTIST. 

PRINTS COME FRAMED IN WHITE, 3/4" WIDE FLAT FACE FRAME 1" DEEP WITH UV ACRYLIC GLASS WHITE. DIMENSIONS ARE 12" X 12".

Edition: 100

Marc Quinn's work is as visually striking as it is thoughtful. A celebrated Young British Artist, Quinn's often uses untraditional materials to exploring the relationship between art and science. 

The original "Eye of History" series was part of an exhibition at Galerie Thaddaeus Ropac, in Salzburg. 

Over the years he has sparked controversy with the placement of his large-scale sculptures, most recently during the 2013 Venice Art Biennale, with the depiction of a pregnant Allison Lapper in front of the church of San Giorgio Maggiore. T

his print is signed and numbered by the artist and comes framed in white.

name: Christopher Wool (IVAM & Musées de Strasbourg) [SIGNED]
description:
Author:  Christopher Wool
Title: Christopher Wool IVAM & Musées de Strasbourg

First edition, first printing. Signed in red ink on the title page by Wool. Hardcover. Black paper-covered boards, with photographically illustrated dust jacket. 

Paintings and photographs by Christopher Wool. Text (in French and English) by Fabienne Keller, Robert Grossmann, Francisco Camps Ortiz, Fabrice Hergott, Consuelo Císcar Casabán, Marga Pz and David Rimanelli. Includes a list of exhibited works, a biography, exhibition history and a bibliography. 

232 pp., with numerous four-color and black-and-white plates. 11-1/2 x 8-5/8 inches. Published on the occasion of exhibitions at IVAM, Valencià, and Musées de Strasbourg.

CONDITION: New in publisher's shrink wrap (slit open for signature, from the artist's archive).

A beautifully printed exhibition catalogue featuring Wool's best-known work to date.

name: Tauba Auerbach - One Deck of Playing Cards (White Set)
description:
Produced in 2009.

Artist Tauba Auerbach has designed a series of playing cards which builds on her 50/50 work, an exploration of opposites and language. 50/50 culminated in a book published by Deitch Projects in 2009 titled 50/50, 100 pages 100 patterns, 50% white, 50% black.

Shapes Deck (white box) uses four geometric shapes as suits, representing the original suits
in a abstract way.

Decks come with an informational fold out and are encased in a hand numbered, blind-de-bossed, linen slide box with ribbon lift and pull-tab.

Each of the two decks is produced in an edition of 250. Dimensions: 2.75 x 3.75 x 1 in.

Artist:   André Saraiva
Title:  Orangina Print x Collette

Limited Edition Print of 500
Unframed
Pigment print on cotton paper 305 g/m2

76 x 55 cm

Don’t miss pigment prints with original artworks by André from collaboration with Orangina offering a collector’s box set exclusively at colette, limited edition of 500 copies.

name: Taki-183 - Collage - Limited Edition Print
description:
Taki 183

Graffiti writers around the world know the name that started it all, Taki 183. A Kid from 183rd Street in Washington Heights in northern Manhattan, Taki's simple signature captured the attention of a reporter and, in the summer of 1971, an article appeared in The New York Times.

Taki was the first New Yorker to become famous for writing graffiti.

Please take a moment to browse our selection of exclusive, limited edition, fine art prints by Taki 183!

Print Name: Collage

Print Size: 	18 x 24 inches

Edition Size: 	183

Print Materials: 	4-Color Hand Pulled Screen Print on 120lb Matte Paper Stock

Each print is embossed with the PCP seal, signed and numbered by the artist. Certificate of Authenticity included.

name: Jean-Michel Basquiat: "Yellow Plate"
description:
Artist:  Jean-Michel Basquiat
Title:  Yellow Plate

2012

Limoges porcelain

8 1/2 inches diameter  (21.5 cm)

Produced by Ligne Blanche

----------

This plate, made with porcelain from Limoges, represents a painting of one of the most famous underground artist of the 1980s in New York. The patterns illustrated on the plate—graffiti, flames, teeth, conceptual words, creatures, as well as voodoo and superheroes from vintage comics—are typical of the wild and original universe of the artist.

name: Biggie - Tes One
description:
Artist:  Tes One
Title:  Biggie

Artist Tes One pays tribute to the late Biggie Smalls with this portrait titled Target Demo Side B: Biggie.  Available in a limited edition fine art print on paper and gallery-wrapped, stretched canvases in two sizes.

About The Work -- Target Demo: Portraits of the late Christopher Wallace and Tupac Shakur

“Biggie and 2pac will always be examples of how powerful music can be as a medium.  Their ability to translate the often grim, inner-city struggles to the masses had them both praised and vilified.  Played in the streets and targeted in the media - a marketing plan of rivalry set sights on their friendship, fans and the entire hip-hop community. A senseless tragedy over extraordinary talent, “Target Demo” is my tribute to both men.“ Tes One.

About Tes One

Combining traditional and non-traditional techniques, Leon "Tes One" Bedore creates contemporary works of art that contrast nature with technology, grime with grace. Allowing himself to find beauty in the mundane, he is able to juxtapose rejected landscapes with figurative illustrations, all the while identifying what is common between the conversing elements. These opposing forces coexist to create paintings that are both symbolic and metaphorical. 
Select your art:

 Size 	Type 	Edition 	Price 	

24x32 	Paper 	50 	      $250

Artist:  Rostarr

name: NeckFace - Your Last Post
description:
Artist:  Neckface
Title:  Your Last Post

$225.00

Size 	18 x 24 inches
Edition 	Limited Edition of 75
Materials 	Seven-Color Hand Pulled Silk Screen on Coventry Rag, 100% Cotton Archival Paper

"YOUR LAST POST" is a limited edition, six-color silkscreen print by Neckface. Each print is signed by Neckface, numbered, embossed and exclusive to PCP, validated by a Certificate of Authenticity.

These hand-pulled silkscreen prints are crafted in Los Angeles using the finest paper and archival inks. Prints are limited and once they sell out they will not be reproduced.

This print was made to fit a standard frame size of 18 x 24 inches, so you won't have the expense of custom framing.

name: Tim Armstrong - Bad Luck Ltd. Ed. Print
description:
Size 	12 x 12 Inches

Edition 	Limited Edition of 150

Materials 	One-Color Hand Pulled Silk Screen on Coventry Rag, 100% Cotton Archival Paper

All prints are embossed with the PCP seal, signed by Tim Armstrong, numbered and exclusive to Poster Child Prints, validated by a certificate of authenticity.

These hand-pulled silkscreen prints are crafted in Los Angeles using the finest paper and archival inks. Prints are limited and once they sell out they will not be reproduced.

"Bad Luck" is part of a series of original artwork Tim created for his latest project, Tim Timebomb & Friends. Starting last winter Tim started writing, recording and releasing one song a day with original artwork to accompany each single. Over 135 songs have been recorded to date and can be found on TimTimebomb.com. "Some of the songs are my own originals, some are collaborations I've done with other artists, band-mates, and friends. We play a lot of different styles from Punk, Ska, Reggae, Country, Roots etc."

The print size selected for this series plays an important role in the creation of it. 12x12 symbolizes the size of a record cover, something Tim knows a great deal about! Tim has been drawing and painting record covers for years so it seemed fitting that we select this iconic size for the series.

This print was made to fit a US standard frame size, so you won't have the expense of custom framing!

name: Tauba Auerbach: How To Spell the Alphabet (Hardcover)
description:
Author: Tauba Auerbach
Title:  How to Spell the Alphabet

Condition:  New in Shrink-Wrap
Hardcover: 112 pages
Publisher: Deitch Projects (March 1, 2007)
Language: English

How arbitrary are the marks, analog and digital, used to express language, and where do they begin to muck it all up? This first book from Tauba Auerbach, Yes and Not Yes features over 20 new paintings and drawings that spring from those questions. 

They offer an excellent if roundabout answer: while letters are largely arbitrary, they are rich with abstract beauty and conceptual depth. In razor-sharp execution--which reveals her training as a sign painter--Auerbach's works on panel and paper update the abstract conceptual tradition, while retaining its intellectual rigor. 

Uppercase Insides and Numeral Insides recall Russian Suprematism, and, upon further contemplation, turn out to be just what their titles call them. Works based on signal flags and the Ugaritic Alphabet--an extinct language from Syria, 1300 B.C.--confirm that puzzlement is part of the desired effect here. 

Where direct exchange between sign and meaning is impossible, the beauty of the symbol comes to the fore.

name: Gary Hume - Tate Modern Exhibition Catalog (Signed)
description:
Author:  Gary Hume
Title:  Tate Modern Exhibition Catalog 

Condition:  Like New First Edition with Artist Signature

Signed copy of the Gary Hume book which coincides with the exhibition at Tate Britain, June 2013. Born in 1962, Gary Hume emerged as one of the leading figures of the group of young artists working in London in the 1990s, known as the YBAs. 

After graduating from Goldsmiths College, London, in 1988, he achieved early success with paintings based on hospital doors, rendered with gloss on panel and displayed in groups of four. Despite their international success, Hume abandoned the formal manoeuvering of the door series in the early 1990s, in favour of a simple, flat figurative and abstract paintings, featuring startling colourcombinations and appropriated images ranging from animals to celebrities to flowers.

Hume was nominated for the Turner Prize in 1996, represented Britain at the Venice Biennale in 1999, and was elected a Royal Academician in 2001. His work has been the subject of a number of monographic shows in UK and Europe.

Published to coincide with the Gary Hume exhibition at Tate Britain in June 2013, this book will include thirty paintings by Hume, encompassing works from almost twenty years of his career as well brand new pieces. 

Including an introductory essay by Katharine stout and an essay by US art writer Jack Bankowsky, this concise account of Hume’s work is a timely addition to the bibliography of this important British contemporary painter.

Katharine Stout is Curator (Contemporary British Art) at Tate.

name: Testing Testing One Two Three:  Curtis Kulig
description:
Author:  Curtis Kulig
Title:  Testing Testing One Two Three

TESTING, TESTING, ONE TWO THREE IS AN ART BOOK WITH CURTIS KULIG'S PHOTOGRAPHY. 

ALL COPIES ARE SIGNED BY THE ARTIST. VERY LIMITED EDITION OF 60.

name: Gary Hume - Signed Original Painting - 1000 Windows
description:
Hang an original Gary Hume on the wall with one of his '1000 Windows' paintings, all individually handpainted and signed by the artist. 

The paintings each act as a stand alone piece and are in a bright yellow frame. As they are individually handpainted by the artist they each have their own individual features and imperfections.

Limited edition of 1000 and provided by the artist exclusive to the Tate Modern, this rare edition was offered in conjunction with and to go alongside the Summer exhibition at Tate Britain. 

Measures 37 x 31.5cm. Paint on paper.

name: Tauba Auerbach - Folds
description:
Author:  Taura Auerbach
Title:  Folds

November 2011, English
9" x 11.75", 100 pages, 65 color ill., hardcover

In connection with Tauba Auerbach's exhibition "Tetrachromat" at Bergen Kunsthall, Folds presents Auerbach's eponymous painting series for the first time in book form. 

In these paintings Auerbach twists and folds the canvas before applying the paint. In its stretched form the flat canvas conjures a trompe l'oeil rendering of its previous three-dimensional state. 

Transferred to the medium of the book, the paintings are presented here in a new and unexpected way alongside mathematical diagrams and three texts.

name: Mr. Brainwash - "Art Is Not a Crime"
description:
Artist:  Mr. Brainwash
Title:  Art is Not Crime

30″ x 22.5″ 6-color Screenprint 
Edition of 90 

Each print is signed, numbered and thumb printed by the artist

name: Eddie Martinez - Time Assassin - Limited Edition Print
description:
Artist:  Eddie Martinez
Title:  Time Assassin

Material:  Paper
Edition Size:  50
Condition:  Mint
Framed:  Yes

THIS ARCHIVAL INKJET PRINT IS A SIGNED LIMITED EDITION. EACH PRINT IS ACCOMPANIED BY A CERTIFICATE OF AUTHENTICITY THAT IS SIGNED AND NUMBERED BY THE ARTIST. FRAMING OPTIONS ARE BLACK OR WHITE PAINTED WOOD, 3/4" WIDE FLAT FACE AND 1" DEEP. GLAZING IS GLASS. SIGNATURE CUT-OUT IN BACK DISPLAYS THE ARTIST'S SIGNATURE.

About the Artist:

Eddie Martinez’s 2011 solo exhibition, Seeker, at Peres Projects in Berlin drew rave reviews. This past summer Martinez followed up with two new painting shows and a book of drawings published in September featuring an essay by art legend Glenn O’Brien, who notes the “totemic power” of Martinez’s abstract imagery. 

Critics have cited influences from Picasso to Hockney to Guston, but you saw it for yourself at Halsey McKay in East Hampton where Eddie participated in a two-person show with Jose Lerma or at half gallery on the LES where his September show was a NY Observer “not to miss.”

name: Giant: Eternal (Hardcover)
description:
Author:  Michael Giant
Title:  Giant

First Edition Hardcover Signed (Like New)

Hardcover: 320 pages
Publisher: Gingko Press Inc. (May 1, 2013)
Language: English

International icon of black ink, artist Michael (GIANT) LeSage incorporates a broad swathe of influences and skills in the creation of a singular, unmistakable aesthetic. Mike's central practice, drawing, is informed by his training in architectural drafting, his illustrious career as a tattooist and worldwide exploits writing on walls. 

Within his latest and most complete monograph, the reader will enjoy photos of perfectly executed tattoos, page after page of Mike's inscrutable tattoo flash, hand lettering nonpareil, and of course tons of drawings, graffiti pieces and action shots. 

GIANT's worldwide travels - inking people, places and finer drawing paper around the world from Amsterdam to London, Thailand, Toronto, New York and back home to San Francisco are also given due prominence. Buddhism, track bikes, designing for apparel brand Rebel8, and painting fill Lesage's hours, but at the end of the day, it all comes full circle, back to his unwaveringly mindful solid black lines.

name: Jeff Koons - Jeff Koons (Hardcover)
description:
Author:  Jeff Koons
Title:  Jeff Koons

Condition:  Like New

Hardcover: 592 pages
Publisher: TASCHEN America Llc; First Edition edition (April 1, 2009)
Language: English

From kinky to kitsch to conceptual, Jeff Koons s art is anything but conformist. Since he stirred up the art world establishment in the 1980s with his unapologetic basketball sculptures and stainless steel toy blow-ups, Koons has been known as somewhat of a bad boy a reputation he confirmed in the early 90s via works depicting him having sex with then-wife Cicciolina, the Italian porn star-cum-politician. Following this torrid phase, he changed gears to produce the gargantuan Puppy, the 43-foot tall floral terrier that now resides at the Guggenheim Museum in Bilbao, Spain. 

Koons' exploitation of the banal, in the aggrandizement and/or embodiment of kitsch and pop imagery, has become his trademark; detractors may delight in their naysaying, but Koons s work commands millions at auction and his position at the forefront of contemporary art is indisputable.

name: Cyrcle - Beautiful Disaster
description:
Artist:  Cyrcle
Title:  Beautiful Disaster

Size 	18 x 24 inches
Edition 	Limited Edition of 100
Materials 	Four-Color Screen Print with UV finish on Coventry Rag, 100% Cotton Archival Paper

In conjunction with our exclusive release, CYRCLE hand painted "Beautiful Disaster" on the infamous Roxy Theater here in LA.

This hand-pulled silkscreen print, "Beautiful Disaster" is embossed with the PCP seal, signed and numbered by the artist and exclusive to Poster Child Prints. Certificate of Authenticity included.

name: Parra Limited Edition Print - "The One Who Got Away"
description:
SIGNED LIMITED EDITION RUN OF 50 19" x 27" Prints

Parra is a former graphic designer, now current business and creative head of the streetwear brand Rockwell, who follows in a long tradition of commercial artists like Andy Warhol and KAWS who later found their footing in contemporary art. 

Parra shares Takashi Murakami’s super flat appreciation of image-making, but with a sly sense of humor and a spare visual irreverence. His anthropomorphized characters reek havoc on the romantic in bold primary blocking that’s unmistakably Parra, producing prints that ooze his signature contrast of deep blues and reds. 

The print ships within 10 business days of purchase.
 
THIS ARCHIVAL INKJET PRINT IS A LIMITED EDITION. EACH PRINT IS ACCOMPANIED BY A CERTIFICATE OF AUTHENTICITY THAT IS SIGNED AND NUMBERED BY THE ARTIST. FRAMING OPTIONS ARE BLACK PAINTED WOOD, 3/4" WIDE FLAT FACE AND 1" DEEP. GLAZING IS GLASS.

name: Ryan McGinness - No Sin/No Future (Signed)
description:
Author:  Ryan McGinness
Title:  No Sin/No Future

First Edition of 2,500 (Signed)

The limited edition from Ryan McGinness - No Sin / No Future is a catalogue turned artist's book published on the occasion of his simultaneous No Sin / No Future exhibitions at CAIS Gallery in Seoul and Hong Kong. Following the trajectory of the now out of print Project Rainbow (2003, Gingko Press), the book is a collaged collection of snapshots, sketches, and scans, culled from the artist's studio archives. Sketchbook notes collide with paintings-in-progress and combine with vectors and bitmaps creating a dense site-specific visual mash-up that provides insight into the mind and process of the artist. The work of Ryan McGinness is highly influential in graphic design and visual art circles, and is collected by many venerable institutions including the Museum of Modern Art in New York.

name: Tauba Auerbach - 50/50
description:
Author:  Tauba Auerbach
Title:  50/50

Brand New in Shrink-Wrap
First Edition

Hardcover: 100 pages
Publisher: Deitch Projects (June 1, 2008)
Language: English

In her drawings, paintings and artist's books, San Francisco-based Tauba Auerbach investigates the relationship between spoken and written language, focusing especially on those points where the familiar structure begins to break down or slip. 

She rigorously yet playfully pushes at the boundaries of our comprehension by rearranging and abstracting words and letters. 

With a razor sharp style that reveals her training as a professional sign painter, Auerbach makes works on panel and paper that are a refreshing spin on the traditions of Conceptual art and Concrete poetry. 

This volume features her 50/50 series of large-scale drawings, all of which consist of halftone patterns that express the same shade of gray.

Auerbach, who was born in 1981, is represented by Deitch Projects in New York. She graduated from Stanford University, where she studied with Margaret Kilgallen.

name: John Baldessari: Supreme Skateboard Deck Set (3)
description:
Set of all 3 John Baldessari x Supreme Skateboard Decks in Mint Condition and Still in Shrink Wrap.

Limited Edition, Long Sold Out

Based on images from Baldessari's popular faces/noses editions, these skateboard decks make an excellent addition to any collection, and are probably one of the more affordable ways a collector can get their hands on a John Baldessari work that they can hang on their wall.

name: Shepard Fairey - Mayday: The Art of Shepard Fairey (1st Ed. Signed)
description:
Author:  Shepard Fairey
Title:  Mayday - The Art of Shepard Fairey

Condition:  Like New

First Edition and Signed and dated by Author.
Gingko Press, Berkeley, 2011. 
Hardcover.

An ancient holiday, the International Worker's Day, and a distress signal: Mayday means all of these things and flipping through Mayday: The Art of Shepard Fairey is a little like listening to Talking Head's Life During Wartime: its fun and bouncy yet dead serious at the same time. 

This is a 1st Edition/1st Printing *SIGNED* with marker by Shepard Fairey across almost the entire breadth of the title page. Mayday not only includes numerous and striking color plates of works from Fairey's Obey Giant exhibition, but also includes sections on the artist's process, his street art campaigns, and public reactions to his art, as well as essays by Jeffrey Deitch (head of the Museum of Contemporary Art in Los Angeles) and the writer, visual artist and documentarian Antonino D'Ambrosio.

name: John Baldessari:  Pure Beauty by Jessica Morgan
description:
Author:  Jessica Morgan
Title:  John Baldessari: Pure Beauty (LACMA)

First Edition - Hardcover Edition

Edited by Jessica Morgan and Leslie Jones.

- 324 pages, 12 x 10 x 1 inches
- 240 illustrations, many in color
- 2009
- Condition:  New

John Baldessari: Pure Beauty was published in conjunction with a major exhibition organized by the Los Angeles County Museum of Art and Tate Modern in London which also travelled to Spain and will be seen in New York City. 

For nearly five decades Los Angeles artist John Baldessari has challenged our ways of viewing art, images, and text. With nearly 250 illustrations and a wide range of insightful essays, it’s the “must have” book on a legendary California artist who is also one of the most influential figures in contemporary art.

Eleven essays by critics, curators, art historians, and an artist and former student of Baldessari's round out this lavish and comprehensive volume. The hardcover edition features a pull-out poster.

Jessica Morgan is Curator of Contemporary Art, Tate Modern, London. Leslie Jones is Associate Curator of Prints and Drawings at the Los Angeles County Museum of Art.

description:

Having been dubbed the "Gold Marilyn" skateboard among serious skateboard deck collectors. Part of a limited series run in 2010, these pop-art skate decks were created by Alien Workshop as part of their artist series and sold out immediately via the Alien Workshops website and select skateboard outlets.

Safely stored the deck remains still sealed in mint/new condition. Even more impressive in person, these look incredible wall mounted or displayed. The ultimate gift for any fan and a truly rare piece that will continue to grow in value.

name: Richard Prince - Hippie Drawings
description:
Author:  Richard Prince
Title:  Hippie Drawings

First Edition
Unsigned
Condition:  Like New/Excellent

Out of Print Edition of one of Richard Prince's most popular and irreverent publications, enjoyable to read, fun to look at, and smart to collect.

name: Marc McKee:  Seen Unknown - The Art of Marc McKee
description:
Author:  Marc McKee
Title:  Seen Unknown - The Art of Marc McKee

In 1989 Marc McKee got his start creating skateboard graphics for World Industries and many of its subsidiaries, like Blind, 101, Menace, A-Team and Almost. 

Spearheaded by McKee, this era is considered the golden age of skateboard art, whose funny, sexy and offensive graphics were hugely popular then and are considered highly collectable today. 

McKee was also the editor of Big Brother Magazine during its first four years and later worked on the Blunt Snowboard Magazine, before selling both to Larry Flynt Publications. Today, McKee continues to make art for skateboard companies.

name: Mike Miller - West Coast Hip-Hop (Signed)
description:
Author:  Mike Miller
Title:  West Coast Hip-Hop

Signed by the Author in Mint Condition

This classic piece of Hip Hop History is a 200 page Hardcover amazing 9×12 coffee table art book with over 50 of the west’s most important Hip Hop artist’s including Never b4 seen pix & stories of Tupac,Ice Cube, Easy E,Snoop Dogg, Too Short, etc

West Coast Hip Hop A History In Pictures – Michael Miller

Michael Miller was the man at the right time when the west coast hip hop movement was exploding. Besides shooting all the major players in the game he also hung out with the artists and became a part of the culture. Shooting important figures like Cypress Hill, NWA, Tupac, Ice Cube, Snoop, House Of Pain, etc, etc His photo’s are an amazing archive of a magical time in music and his crazy but true stories about the shoots are mind blowing!

name: Ryan McGinness - Women - Signed Ltd. Ed. Book
description:
Author:  Ryan McGinness
Title:  Women: New (Re)Presentations

Published by Quint Contemporary Art
8.5 x 11 in., 184 pages
ISBN: 978-0-615-72511-6
Printed in an edition of 750
500 signed and numbered by the artist

name: Krookerd Skateboards: Gonzalez x Kulig 2013 Ltd. Ed. Collaboration Deck
description: Krooked Gonz Kolabo Limited Edition Skareboard Deck 8.18 x 31.84

name: Richard Prince by Nancy Spector and Jack Bankowsky
description:
Authors:  Nancy Spector and Jack Bankowsky
Title:  Richard Prince
Edition:  First Edition Hardback
Dimensions:  28.6 x 20.8 x 3.4 cm
Condition:  Like New

This is the most extensive overview to date of Richard Prince's provocative oeuvre. 

This comprehensive presentation of Prince's work collects the highlights from his many groups of works, including early appropriated photographs and photographic series such as Cowboys, Girlfriends, and Upstate; painted canvases such as Jokes, White Paintings, Check Paintings, and Nurses; and the Hood sculptures. Along with expert texts and a series of interviews with prominent personalities from the cultural scene, this publication draws an especially multifaceted, profound portrait of Prince's art.

name: Mike Brodie - A Period of Juvenille Prosperity
description:
Author:  Mike Brodie
Title:  A Period of Juvenille Prosperity

104 Pages, 11" x 13", Hard Cover. First Edition. Out of Print. 

At 17 Mike Brodie hopped his first train close to his home in Pensacola, FL thinking he would visit a friend in Mobile, AL. 

Instead the train went in the opposite direction to Jacksonville, FL. Days later, Brodie rode the same train home, arriving back where he started. Nonetheless, it sparked something and Brodie began to wander across the U.S. by any means that were free - walking, hitchhiking and train hopping. 

Shortly after, Brodie found a Polaroid camera stuffed behind a car seat. With no training in photography and coke-bottle glasses, the instant camera was an opening for Brodie to document his experiences. As a way of staying in touch with his transient community,Brodie shared his pictures on various websites gaining the moniker The Polaroid Kidd. When the Polaroid film he used was discontinued, Brodie switched to 35mm film and a sturdy 1980s camera. 

Brodie spent years crisscrossing the U.S. amassing a collection, now appreciated as one of the most impressive archives of American travel photography. 

When asked about his approach to travel and photography Brodie has said: sometimes I take a train the wrong way or...whatever happens a photo will come out of it, so it doesn't really matter where I end up.

name: KAWS - Downtime
description:
Author: KAWS
Title: Downtime

Format	Hardcover
Publication Date	2012-08-01
Language	English
Publisher	High Museum of Art

Brand New, sealed in shrink wrap.
Never opened
Mint Condition
Purchased directly from Kawsone.com

name: Todd Francis x Atlas Skateboards - Limited Skateboard Deck (Guitar)
description:
Artist: Todd Francis
Title: Atlas Collaboration Guitar Skateboard Deck

Condition: Mint in Shrinkwrap
Signed and Numbered by the Artist

14/50

7-ply skateboard. 8"

Todd Francis is an American artist born and raised in Los Angeles. Since 1993 he has created memorable and iconic skateboard graphics for a number of skate companies including Antihero Skateboards (Todd created the Eagle logo), Element, Spitfire, New Deal and Stereo.

In addition, Todd has collaborated on signature design projects with respected brands such as Vans, Nike, Oakley, Stance, HUF and Atlas. His work combines often-bleak humor with environmental and political concerns, using a variety of media to convey his various messages.

Todd has been featured in numerous skate, art and culture magazines like Monster Children, Complex, Print, Color, Slap and The Skateboard Mag.

His artwork has appeared in a long list of gallery shows nationally and internationally, including a 2008 retrospective at the 3131 Gallery (Equal Dist) in San Francisco, CA and in the board graphics section of several of the Beautiful Losers art shows from 2004 to 2005.

He is also a featured artist and speaker in the ongoing Full Deck: A Short History of Skate Art; a traveling art show that has toured major galleries since 2009. Releasing in early 2013 is Look Away: The Art of Todd Francis; a book spotlighting his career and his art.

name: Todd Francis x Atlas Skateboards - Limited Skateboard Deck (Harmonica)
description:
Artist:  Todd Francis
Title:  Atlas Collaboration Harmonica Skateboard Deck

Condition:  Mint in Shrinkwrap
Signed and Numbered by the Artist 

17/50

7-ply skateboard. 8"

Todd Francis is an American artist born and raised in Los Angeles. Since 1993 he has created memorable and iconic skateboard graphics for a number of skate companies including Antihero Skateboards (Todd created the Eagle logo), Element, Spitfire, New Deal and Stereo. 

In addition, Todd has collaborated on signature design projects with respected brands such as Vans, Nike, Oakley, Stance, HUF and Atlas. His work combines often-bleak humor with environmental and political concerns, using a variety of media to convey his various messages.

Todd has been featured in numerous skate, art and culture magazines like Monster Children, Complex, Print, Color, Slap and The Skateboard Mag. 

His artwork has appeared in a long list of gallery shows nationally and internationally, including a 2008 retrospective at the 3131 Gallery (Equal Dist) in San Francisco, CA and in the board graphics section of several of the Beautiful Losers art shows from 2004 to 2005. 

He is also a featured artist and speaker in the ongoing Full Deck: A Short History of Skate Art; a traveling art show that has toured major galleries since 2009. Releasing in early 2013 is Look Away: The Art of Todd Francis; a book spotlighting his career and his art.

name: Chris Johanson - Bakerz Dozen Skateboard Deck
description:
Edition of 13 decks. pressed, shaped, and screened in the USA. 

 Just shy of 30" long, 14" wheel base, 6" tail.

name: Zevs - Liquidated Google
description:
Liquidated Google

Zevs

Edition of 75

50 cm x 75 cm

2013

Four-color screen print on Arches 88 300gsm paper

Signed and numbered by the artist

Zevs (pronounced "Zeus", like the king of the Greek gods) is one of the most politicised artists within Lazarides' already partisan roster.

The Parisian is an inspired practitioner of street work. Besides the Liquidation project, his trademark techniques include using steam cleaners to create images on dirty walls during a graffiti crackdown in his native city, and invisible ink paintings only visible under UV light. These invisible ink pieces include a portrait of the 9/11 hijackers in the room they stayed in the night before their fateful act.

Zevs' Liquidated Logo series is arguably the most direct and recognisable example of street art culture jamming. He is prominently featured in Oscar-nominated documentary Exit Through the Gift Shop. After many years of public activity his work has garnered considerable attention from France's "high art" establishment, blurring as it does the line between street pieces, conceptual art, and good old-fashioned angry vandalism.

name: Sean Cliver Supreme Skateboard Deck Set - "Halloween" & "Dick & Jane"

Print Type 	Printer's Proof

A gorgeous set of 10 inverted metallic printer's proofs was produced for Beejoir's 'Colour of Money' Edition. 5 with gold symbols and silver backgrounds and 5 with silver symbols and gold backgrounds. These make excellent sets and look stunning in person. Signed by both the artist & printer.  Rare and a great edition to any contemporary or street art collection.

name: Joshua Abelow - Dancing Man - Limited Edition Print
description:
Artist: Joshua Abelow
Title:  Dancing Man

Size: 17" x 21.5"

THIS ARCHIVAL INKJET PRINT IS A LIMITED EDITION AND COMES WITH A CERTIFICATE OF AUTHENTICITY SIGNED BY THE ARTIST. FRAMING OPTION IS BLACK PAINTED WOOD, 3/4" WIDE FLAT FACE. FRAME IS 1" DEEP WITH UV ACRYLIC GLASS.

Joshua Abelow, currently in the “Jew York” exhibition at Zach Feuer Gallery and founder of Art Blog Art Blog, was born in 1976 in Frederick, Maryland. Abelow graduated with a BFA from Rhode Island School of Design in 1998 and an MFA in painting from the Cranbrook Academy of Art in 2008. According to the artist his “work is a kind of abstract, autobiographical storytelling. I use text, figuration, and geometric abstraction to piece together different narratives that are interconnected.” 

Abelow had solo exhibitions at Sorry We’re Closed, Brussels (2012); Brand New Gallery, Italy (2012) and Frieze New York with James Fuentes (2012). The artist will have his second New York solo exhibition with James Fuentes in the fall (2013). The artist lives and works in Brooklyn, NY.

This image is part of a series which depicts a dancing figure and uses Kazimir Malevich's "Bather" from 1911 as a point of reference. Abelow says, "I think of my work as non-linear, autobiographical story telling.  I use text, figuration, and geometric abstraction to piece together different narratives that are interconnected. Many of the themes in my visual work are also found in my writing, as I am interested in the relationship between text and image. I'm thinking about the idea of the artist as performer.  Or even the artist as magician."

name: Russell Marshall - Just Sid (Pink)
description:
From Russell Marshall's famed mug shot series, comes the symbol of punk rock, the one and only Sid Vicious in the work entitled "Just Sid"

    Year: 2012

    Medium: Two color screen print on 410 gram Somerset paper

    Description: Signed and numbered by the artist

    Size: 66 x 88 cms

    Edition: 45

name: Richard Prince - Cowboys Exhibit Poster Signed
description:
Richard Prince
Signed Cowboys Poster

Produced in 2013, in conjunction with "Richard Prince: Cowboys" at Gagosian Gallery Beverly Hills.

55 x 32 1/2 inches (139.7 x 82.6 cm) (This is an extremely large poster and is meant to be the focal point of whichever room its owner decides to hang it in. 

The poster is signed and it is made out of a thick stock paper.

For collectors old and new, a signed Richard Prince work is one of the few sure things in the world of collecting contemporary art.  

Perhaps it is the scarcity of more conventional visual art pieces by Mr. Prince, or perhaps it is his age combined with the mystique surrounding his life and work, but spend some time on his own signed book website, on Printed Matter, eBay, and other contemporary art outlets and you will discover what is probably already readily apparent to the more seasoned collector, Richard Prince is in a class of his own with respect to his place as a coveted artist to collect.  

This mint unframed signed poster from the 2013 Beverly Hills Gagosian Richard Prince Cowboy Exhibition is one of the few instances where a collector can obtain a MINT signed piece of art from Richard Prince without the price well above $5000.

name: Mark Gonzales - Untitled (Girl with Ponytail) & Untiled (Man with Hat)
description:
1. Untitled [Girl with Ponytail]
Mark Gonzales
New York, NY : Printed Matter Inc.. 2010

2.  Untitled [Man with Hat)
Mark Gonzales
New York, NY : Printed Matter Inc.. 2010

Created as a special edition for Printed Matter's 2010 spring warehouse sale, Mark Gonzales's limited edition monochrome screenprint features his signature graceful/gawky style. 

Printed in blue ink, Gonzales's untitled piece recalls the inspired ball point pen doodlings of high school notebooks. 

One of two editions made by Gonzales for the warehouse sale, the other is Untitled [Man with Hat].

Category: Printed Matter Edition

name: Mekanism Warren Du Preez & Nick Thornton Jones (Limited Edition Signed by Artist)
description:
Title: Warren Du Preez & Nick Thorton Mekanism Limited Edition Series

Limited Series Details: This deck is number 4 of a series of 100 made and of 20 that were signed.

artists.name: Warren Du Preez & Nick Thornton Jones

description:
This hand pulled, seven-color silkscreen, "Gold Finger" is by artist Chad Muska. Each print is signed by Chad. Prints are numbered, embossed and exclusive to PCP, validated by a Certificate of Authenticity.

Chad's first print edition is in conjunction with his recent solo show "Transitions" New Image Art.

This print was made to fit a standard frame size of 18 x 24 inches, so you won't have the expense of custom framing.

“Gold Finger”

18 x 24 inches

Limited Edition of 100

Seven Color Silkscreen Print with Metallic Gold Ink Printed on Coventry Rag, 100% Archival Paper

Each print is embossed with the PCP seal, signed by Chad Muska, numbered and exclusive to Poster Child Prints.

Validated with a Certificate of Authenticity.

name: The Jay-Z "Big Pimpin" Skateboard Deck by Wemoto
description:
One of the famed rare hip-hop skateboard decks that pop up from time to time, but never last long when first released. Along with the Baker "Biggie & Tupac" Deck, the De la Soul and A Tribe Called Quest Deck, this board is a great addition to any aspiring collector with an affinity for raps and rhymes.

This deck is in MINT condition and is still in its original shrink wrap.

8' Canadian Maple Ply

description:
Ryan McGinness

Sponsorship REDUX Show Print, 2011

Serigraph, Edition of 500

18 x 24 inches

name: GIRL x SANRIO - Keropi
description:
This GIRL collaboration is sure to be a rare and high priced collector's item, but as it is not the 35 anniversary board, we are offering it for prices more fair, but still reflective to that premium all things Hello Kitty have placed upon them in the collectables market. Likely to be purchased by a non-Skateboarder.

MINT CONDITION in Shrink-Wrap.

name: Toy Machine - "Last Supper Deck"
description: The Toy Machine Last Supper Deck features a custom graphic of all your favorite Toy Machine characters, it's their last supper and they're making it a good one. Grip it, slap some trucks on it and ride it! 8" X 31.5"

name: Mekanism Skateboards Artist Series - Delta (Ltd. Ed. of 100)
description:
Mekanism Skateboards 
Delta 
Untitled Hand Signed 
Born 1968 - The Netherlands

Boris Tellegen a.k.a. DELTA is an industrial designer/engineer and visual artist who works primarily in the field of graffiti painting. A pioneer of the European Graffiti movement of the mid eighties, Delta literally reinvents both the traditional presentation mode of visual art, as well as the genre of graffiti painting itself, by introducing an abstract and highly architectural style of painting to the street.

name: Supreme x Robert Longo: The "Angel" Skateboard Deck
description:
Skateboard Deck: Angel 
Artist: Robert Longo 
Skateboard Manufacturer: Supreme NYC 
Limited Edition Series of 300 
Year: 2010

Robert Longo is an American painter and sculptor made famous in the eighties with his series of “Men in the Cities”. Leader and main guitarist of a punk rock group, he also directed music videos for artists such as New Order and R.E.M., as well as short and feature films.

The "Angel" skateboard deck is in MINT condition and is still in the shrink wrap from Supreme along with the bag the skateboard came in.

The Sk8Room has valued this deck at $725.00

name: David Choe x Giant Robot: The "Sweater" Deck
description:
This limited edition skateboard deck is by the world renowned artist, David Choe, through a collaboration with the Los Angeles art gallery Giant Robot for the gallery's 15th anniversary.

Famous for being the "richest artist in the world", David Choe's art is found in the Oval Office and the walls of Facebook's Silicon Valley offices.

Part of a two deck series, "Angel" is a vibrant piece of original art and is demonstrative of the vast talent Mr. Choe is bringing to the art world and to the world of toys and skateboarding.

The deck is in MINT condition and is still in the manufacturer's shrink-wrap.

As the awareness and popularity of Mr. Choe rises, likely to the heights of Hirst and Murakami, this deck, which is already sold out and extremely rare, will have a value far beyond today's estimated value, per The Sk8Room, of $500.

name: Frank Kozik - Margaret Thatcher Skate Deck
description:
Frank Kozik 
(1962-present)

Frank Kozik is a Spanish-born artist who has worked on the cover art of major rock bands and produced in excess of 300 vinyl art toys. He runs a media outlet and record label and has published several books. Influenced by the growing underground punk rock scene of the mid-eighties, he is credited for solely reviving the art of the concert poster.

In his series of politically charged skateboard decks, Kozik takes aim at a group of world figures taken right of the height of the Western excess of the 1980s, with the companion deck to the Margaret Thatcher deck being Ronald Reagan.

The Sk8Room has this hand signed limited edition deck (out of a series of 100) valued at $500 (350 EUROS), an estimate that can be verified using the following link:

https://www.thesk8room.com/products/skateboard-frank-kozik-margaret-tatcher#

With Thatcher's passing last week, the deck is certain to become the focus of more intensive efforts to round up the remaining available deck from this very limited hand-signed skateboard deck. A collectable sure to impress even the most seasoned and well financed of collectors.

Given our mission to end the prohibitive price increases seen on eBay, we always seek to offer our decks at a price below that of any verifiable estimates and below the average price we have noted from recent comparable eBay sales.

The skateboard deck is in MINT condition and is still in shrink-wrap with a portion cut out so that Kozik could sign, number and date the signature.

As we want you to feel comfortable purchasing the board without being able to look at it in person, we guarantee its condition to the extent we accept returns of any deck we send you that does not meet your expectations or does not appear as it did in the picture.

This is an issue we don't expect to ever occur, but an assurance we believe we owe our clients as we work to build our own brand and reputation in this area of the skateboard retail market.

name: KAWS - 2010 First Edition Signed by Author with Original Art
description:
Multidisciplinary artist KAWS was first known for his work as a graffiti artist and his subversive approach to popular imagery on bus shelter and phone booth advertisements. This is the first comprehensive survey of the artist’s body of work.

There are a select few first editions signed with original artwork, and we have one to offer our visitors.

SIGNED WITH ORIGINAL DRAWING. Original drawing in silver marker, signed by KAWS, dated, but not personalized. 

Drawing features a snake-like, twisting, Companion type "Bendy" figure with the signature XX Kaws' eyes.

Condition: Like New 

Hardcover: 256 pages
Publisher: Skira Rizzoli (November 9, 2010)
Language: English
Product Dimensions: 8.5 x 1.1 x 11 inches

name: Mark Gonzales - The Priest Toy
description:
Skateboard legend Mark Gonzales’ distinctive artwork has piqued the interest of skaters and art fans alike for decades. 

The Priest illustration has a long history, as the original black & white image was first adapted into a three-dimensional sculpture in which castings served as a canvas for Gonzales’ original art. 

Now the Priest has been carefully recreated from the original sculpture into a high-quality designer vinyl toy.

Standing at over 10” tall, you may display your Priest with a choice of two expressions – happy or angry, determined by your mood….but literally determined by a twist of his poseable head. 

This limited-edition run was produced in Tokyo, Japan, and is collaboration between Super7 and Krooked Skateboards. Each figure comes packaged in a deluxe collector’s box, illustrated throughout with Gonz artwork.

name: Damien Hirst - The Complete Medicine Cabinets - Signed First Edition
description:
Publication Date: February 1, 2011

Published on the occasion of Damien Hirst’s exhibition at L&M Arts, New York, in October 2010, this first--and complete--book on the artist's medicine cabinets is contextualized by the artist’s following of the punk movement. 

The first twelve sculptures in the book are named after the title tracks on the Sex Pistols’ Never Mind the Bollocks album. The front-page newspaper spreads punctuating the book from the album’s release year (1977) and the year of the cabinets’ completion (1989) provide a context for reading James Frey’s story-poem, Fuck This and Fuck That, which describes the listless protest of a teenage waster. 

The song titles and cabinet names - No Feelings, Liar, and Seventeen - resound with the frustrations of Thatcherite Britain and the violence borne out in daily uprest and anarchy, as depicted in the news: IRA MEN HELD IN BIG SWOOP; RIOT SHIELDS OUT AGAIN and DOCKS JOBS-FOR-LIFE TO BE AXED BY AUTUMN. 

Hirst’s medicine cabinets have long been described as temples of medicinal hierarchies providing nothing more than a short-term cure in the face of death. Viewing the pervasive successes and exploitations of the pharmaceutical industry as a belief system in itself is evidence of our society's dependency and a form of escapism. 

Hirst has commented: "I’ve always seen medicine cabinets as bodies, but also like a cityscape or civilization, with some sort of hierarchy within it. It’s also like a contemporary museum of the Middle Ages. 

In a hundred years’ time this will look like an old apothecary. A museum of something that’s around today."

The publication features a transcription of a radio conversation between Damien Hirst and Steve Jones, guitarist for the Sex Pistols, covering music, girls, money, drugs, drinks, and smokes. The book’s index lists every medicine cabinet ever made and the exhibition itself includes original Sex Pistols memorabilia including album sleeves and t-shirts.

    Hardcover: 184 pages
    Publisher: Other Criteria (February 1, 2011)
    Product Dimensions: 9 x 0.9 x 7.5 inches 

Some retail sites have this rare edition price at over $4,000....and like anything Hirst that is signed and limited edition, the item, whatever it is, is sure to be nothing short of a sure thing investment.

name: Greg Gossel - The Wedding Is Off (Purple) Ltd. Ed. Print
description:
5 color print on Cougar paper
Dimensions: 19" X 25"
Edition of 150
Signed and numbered by Artist

name: Ed Templeton - Deformer - Signed First Edition
description:
Eleven years in the making and compiling more than 30 years of material, Ed Templeton's scrapbook of his upbringing in suburban Orange County California is a much-anticipated book. 

Its photographs give a sun-drenched glimpse of what it might be like to be young and alive in the suburban domestic incubator of Orange County, conveyed in the idiom of Nan Goldin or Larry Clark (and with a sharp eye for the streets that recalls Garry Winogrand or Eugene Richards). 

For like his groundbreaking predecessors, Templeton is always a participant in the scenes he shoots. From the Alleged Press series curated by Aaron Rose, Deformer interweaves disciplinary letters from Templeton's grandfather and religious notes from his mother with sketches, snapshots, telling images and the occasional brutal tale, laying out an unresolved narrative that plunges readers headlong into Templeton's chaotic youth and his reliance on art and skateboarding to accommodate its stresses and joys. 

Skateboarding allowed me to travel the world, and that showed me that where I live is totally messed up, he observes. That perspective has fueled me and been a source for my art. Through photographs, stories and ephemera of all sorts from his youth and teenage years, Templeton offers readers an intensely close and personal look at an artist's coming of age. 

Deformer is also available in a boxed limited edition which comes with a signed and numbered photograph by Ed Templeton.

Ed Templeton, born in 1972, is a professional skateboarder, co-editor of the arts magazine ANP Quarterly, photographer and artist. His work was featured in the hugely successful traveling show Beautiful Losers. Title: Deformer. [Signed by Ed Templeton].

Publisher: Italy: Damiani Editore

Publication Date: 2008

Binding: Hardcover

Book Condition: As New

Signed: Signed by Author(s)

Edition: 1st Edition

name: Shepard Fairey - Eazy-E Tribute
description:
18 x 24 inch screen print. 

Signed by Shepard Fairey and Michael Miller 

(Photographer http://www.mikemillerphoto.com, Tumblr @mikemillerphoto, Twitter @millerphoto1). 

Numbered edition of 750. 

A portion of the proceeds went to the estate of Eazy E

name: André Saraiva - Yellow Mr. A Ltd. Ed. Print
description:
André Saraiva is a Portuguese graffiti artist you may remember from the Paris night scenes in the art documentary Exit Through the Gift Shop. 

His signature character is a winking smiley face called Mr. A, whose visage was ubiquitous on mailboxes in France during the 1990s. Since then André has become a nightlife legend with his global Le Baron enterprise (Paris, New York, Tokyo, and the occasional pop-up club like Club André during Art Basel Miami). 

He also marked his foray into the world of cinema in 2011 with his film debut, “The Shoe,” starring fellow Exhibition A artist Leo Fitzpatrick and Annabelle Dexter-Jones. 

In 2012 André had his first New York solo exhibition, “Love Letters,” at Half Gallery, plus a major show at The Hole in NYC, and another at Anonymous Gallery in Mexico City. André will paint several large public murals in Miami leading up to Art Basel 2012.

André's trademark design comes alive in yellow on black in a limited edition series of 100.  Using a flourescent yellow contrast with black, the famous happy face has never looked brighter. 

Edition Size:  100

Size:  12" x 12"

name: ABOVE - Passport Signed (25 Edition)
description:
ABOVE: PASSPORT examines the street artist that has blanketed the world with art covering over 90 cities in 60 countries. The book includes hundreds of plates and quotes from artists across the globe and introductory statements by Shepard Fairey, FAILE and the Wooster Collective.

"I first encountered ABOVE’s art on the streets of Paris in early 2003. His large scale trademark arrows were painted on roll down gates, trucks and storefronts with impressive coverage throughout the city. ABOVE is extraordinarily driven. 

To paraphrase Radiohead, “ambition can make you look pretty ugly,” but in  ABOVE’s case, his ambition makes the streets look very engaging. I am very impressed by ABOVE’s diligence, but after I got to know him and his artwork more, I began to realize that his output is not evidence of selfish ego, but of a lust for life, a utopian life, where his generosity, and curiosity, and his pursuit of creativity and social-consciousness have led him around the world making more friends than enemies.

ABOVE made the time to act as tour guide for me and my wife and our two young daughters in a city he knows well and we didn’t. The gesture made me greatly value ABOVE’s friendship and reinforced my belief that what you give is what you get. The Karma Police are not coming for ABOVE even if the police vandal squad is."
---Shepard Fairey, Los Angeles, California

About ABOVE

From WIKI (born circa 1981) has been creating public art since 1995. ABOVE is an international contemporary street artist who keeps his identity concealed and is widely known for his multi-layer/full color social and political stencils, spinning wooden "arrow mobile" installations, and large mural "word play" paintings. 

ABOVE started traditional graffiti of tagging freight trains in California in 1995. ABOVE moved to Paris at the age of 19 where he started painting his trademark arrow (pointing above) all around the city. 

Since then ABOVE has been consistently traveling around the world doing many large self-financed "tours" with each tour exploring a new medium or style of artworks. ABOVE has been successful in putting his street artworks in over 90 cities in 60 different countries around the globe. 

Technical Specs

    Hardcover
    12.25 x 12.25" (31.1 x 31.1cm)
    156 pages
    Over 270 color images
    Edition of 1,000
    Designed by Blaine Fontana of FONTANA STUDIOS
    Release date: October 2011
    $65.00 (Only 25 signed copies available)

name: Limited Edition Kate Moss Book
description:
Exclusive Kate Moss Book

Filled with images selected by Kate Moss herself, this new book traces the entire career of the iconic supermodel through pictures shot by the world's most famous photographers. This cover image shot by Steven Klein is exclusive to Bookmarc and limited to 500 copies.

name: Richard Serra Drawing: A Retrospective (First Edition and Signed by Artist)
description:
A great addition to any growing art book collection, Richard Serra stands out as a bridge of sorts between the new school and old school of art and photography, representing artists ranging from Avedon to Templeton to Prince back to McGinley, always reminding the viewer of his American roots in those pieces that he chooses as his subjects.  



As the focal point of numerous high-profile exhibitions, the sculpture of Richard Serra (b. 1939) has drawn international acclaim. Yet even those who have marveled at Serra's intellectually rigorous and large works of sculpture may not be familiar with his equally intriguing drawings. This handsome book brings together for the first time Serra's drawn work, considering the artist's investigation of medium as an activity both independent from and linked to his pioneering sculptural practice.

First working in ink, charcoal, and lithographic crayon on paper, Serra originally used drawing as a means to explore form and perceptual relations between his sculpture and the viewer. Over time, his drawings underwent significant shifts in concept, materials, and scale and became fully realized and autonomous works of art. 

The grand, bold forms he created with black paintstick in his monumental Installation Drawings were designed to disrupt and complement existent spaces and eventually began to occupy entire rooms. In the late 1980s, Serra explored the tension of weight and gravity through layering, and his most recent work experiments with surface effects, using mesh screens as intermediaries between the gesture and the transfer of pigment to paper.

This FIRST EDITION was published in 2011 and was signed by the ARTIST and then repackaged in plastic wrap so as to ensure the continued integrity of the book would not be compromised.  

You will not regret getting this book; however, once part of a collection, it is unlikely to ever change hands again

name: Shepard Fairey Signed First Edition Book (Rare Copy)
description:
SPECIAL Edition run which was limited to 600 copies.

Signed by Shepard Fairey, the book is entitled Obey: Supply and Demand: The Art of Shepard Fairey 1989–2009 (Boxed Set)

The set includes: 

Four Limited Edition Silkscreens, 9'' x 12'' on 80g Speckletone cover stock plus the first edition of "Supply & Demand: 20th Anniversary Edition"

name: Keith Haring x Alien Workshop Limited Edition (Series I) #2
description:
Image of Keith Haring x Alien Workshop Limited Edition (Series I)

1 
2

$60.00

The Limited Edition Keith Haring Collaboration Series with Alien Workshop, which followed the successful and highly publicized Warhol Series with AWS, was so successful and sold out so fast that they came out with another 10 Skate Deck Designs and released a second series.

We were lucky enough to get one board from each series, but as that now proved excessive, we would like to share some of them with the our fellow collectors.

In MINT CONDITION and still in factory shrink-wrap, this skateboard deck is a great piece of pop-art history from an artist who loved skateboarding and was one of the first to make a piece of original art on an actual skateboard deck.

An artist who left us all too soon, Keith Haring is remembered now through his art and his fans who keep his unique vision of the world up on walls and on the bottoms of our decks.
